entry.title: Les femmes (and les blockbusters) are all the talk at Cannes
entry.summary: This year's Cannes Film Festival is about halfway through, but one thing is already clear: This festival belongs to les femmes.

entry.summary: Jane Fonda is starring in a film at Cannes, but she also came to the film festival to pick up an honor.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: McConaughey, Van Sant film greeted harshly
entry.summary: Director Gus Van Sant and Matthew McConaughey speak with each other at the photo call for the film The Sea of Trees, at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Saturday, May 16, 2015.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Tom Hardy on wheels again in 'Mad Max'
entry.summary: In "Mad Max: Fury Road," which hit theaters this weekend after a wave of critical excitement and a glitzy premiere at the Cannes Film Festival, Hardy is again on the road.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Tom Hardy on wheels again in 'Mad Max'
entry.summary: Actor Tom Hardy during a press conference for the film Mad Max: Fury Road at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Thursday, May 14, 2015.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: A first time for Colin Farrell at Cannes
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Colin Farrell is no longer a Cannes Film Festival virgin.

entry.title: Charlie Hebdo documentary seeks buyers in Cannes
entry.summary: January's terrorist attack on the Paris offices of satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo continues to cast a shadow over France, and the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Naomi Watts resplendent in feathers
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Feathers helped the Cannes Film Festival take flight on the opening-night red carpet.

entry.title: Cannes Watch: Don't ask the Coens about TV
entry.summary: Joel and Ethan Coen are presidents of the jury that will decide the Cannes Film Festival top honor, the Palme d'Or.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary: Members of the media surround workers laying down the red carpet on the steps of the Palais des Festivals ahead of the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Wednesday, May 13, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary: A sign for the 68th international film festival inside the Palais des Festivals, Cannes, southern France, Wednesday, May 13, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - The Cannes Film Festival unrolled its red carpet with a socially minded French drama, striking a more serious tone than the high dose of glamour the festival often opens with.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
Cannes chief seeks sun, more female directors, fewer selfies
entry.summary: As the Cannes Film Festival gets set to open, two trends seem clear: The women are coming - and the selfies are going.

entry.title: Cannes unveils 2015 official selection lineup
entry.summary: Docter was previously in Cannes with "Up," the first animated film ever to open the festival.

entry.title: Jia, Sorrentino, Van Sant in Cannes festival lineup

entry.title: ?La Tete Haute? to open 2015 Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary: The Cannes Film Festival will run from May 13 to 24.

entry.title: 'La Tete Haute' to open Cannes Film Festival, first female-directed film to kick off fest
entry.summary: The festival announced Monday that "La Tete Haute," a French drama directed by Emmanuelle Bercot, will open the 68th Cannes Film Festival on May 13.

entry.title: 'La Tete Haute' to open Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary: NEW YORK (AP) - For the first time, a female director will kick off the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: 'La Tete Haute' to open Cannes Film Festival
Isabella Rossellini to head jury for Cannes Film Festival's Un Certain Regard competition
entry.summary: The festival said Friday she will also attend a Cannes screening of a documentary about her mother.

entry.title: Isabella Rossellini to head Cannes' Un Certain Regard jury
entry.summary: PARIS (AP) - The Cannes Film Festival says Italian-American actress Isabella Rossellini will head the jury for its sidebar competition, Un Certain Regard.

entry.title: Cannes Steps Into Trouble With High-Heels Dress Code
entry.summary: The dust-up is particularly awkward for Cannes because this year's festival has been marked by considerable discussion about gender equality in the movie industry.

entry.title: Celebrity charity rally roars past Cannes finish line
entry.summary: The celebrity charity car rally "Cash & Rocket" roared into Cannes Tuesday, with its band of stars that this year included actress Michelle Rodriguez, model Jodie Kidd and singer Natalie Imbruglia.

entry.title: Celebrity charity rally roars past Cannes finish line
entry.summary: The rally began in Paris, and went on to Lyon and Milan to arrive at the finish line in Cannes " 1,067 Miles (1,717 km) and five days later.

entry.title: Celebrity charity rally roars past Cannes finish line

entry.title: Cannes carpeted over heels policy
entry.summary: The red carpet at Cannes is highly regulated by tradition.

entry.title: Cannes steps into trouble with high-heels dress code
Cannes steps into trouble with high-heels dress code
entry.summary: "There is no specific mention about the height of the women's heels as well as for men's," Aime said of Cannes' dress code.

entry.title: Cannes steps into trouble with high-heels dress code
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) " The Cannes Film Festival is coming under scrutiny for its strict dress code after women not wearing high heels were turned away from a premiere.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: "You'll have a hit movie that women are at the forefront of and people are like 'Oh, it's all changing.' And then I feel like it resorts back to what it was before ... But I do feel that things are changing," said Blunt, who stars in "Sicario," one of the 19 films competing this year for Cannes' top prize.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: Others, like jury member Sienna Miller, used the evening to express how the experience of the Cannes Film Festival has affected them.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) - The star-studded Calvin Klein Women in Film soiree could not have come at a more appropriate moment - at a Cannes Film Festival where the dearth of women directors has been a major theme.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: DiCaprio buys $13,600 bag for charity
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Who knew Leonardo DiCaprio had an eye for Chanel bags?

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: Melanie Laurent poses for photographers upon arrival at the Calvin Klein Women in Film party at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Monday, May 18, 2015.

entry.title: Gallery: Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary: Actress Charlotte Le Bon and Pierre Niney pose for photographers at the screening of the film "Inside Out" at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Monday, May 18, 2015.

entry.title: Amy Poehler and Mindy Kaling in Cannes as they promote Pixar film Inside Out
After a Cannes drubbing, Van Sant reflects on 'Sea of Trees'
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - The full-throated passions of the Cannes Film Festival can elevate, just as they can humble.

Though its official red-carpet premiere on Saturday went down better, the Cannes fate of "The Sea of Trees" was already sealed as (at least thus far) the festival's most rudely received film.

Van Sant says that festival director Thierry Fremaux called to say he wanted the film for Cannes before seeing it.

entry.title: After a Cannes drubbing, Van Sant reflects on 'Sea of Trees'
entry.summary:
"I was, as I always am, cautious," Van Sant said in an interview about showing "The Sea of Trees" at Cannes.

Plenty of films at Cannes have been received negatively this year.

The movie-going public generally has less of an issue with sentimentality than Cannes critics, and McConaughey is one of the most popular stars in film right now.

entry.title: At Cannes, Norway's Trier maps complex US family drama
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Norwegian director Joachim Trier thinks the best qualities of American cinema have moved to TV - and he wants them back.

The film, which is competing for the top prize at Cannes, the Palme d'Or, has an elaborate structure but a simple message: Families are complicated.

entry.title: At Cannes, Norway's Trier maps complex US family drama
CANNES WATCH: Andie MacDowell stuns in coral gown
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) - Proving that age is no barrier to beauty, a radiant Andie MacDowell went for some old-fashioned va-va-voom in an Elie Saab gown in coral on the Cannes red carpet.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: John Turturro talks onset bad behavior
entry.summary: "I've seen all kinds of crazy behavior," said Turturro, who won Cannes' best-actor prize in 1991 for "Barton Fink."

entry.title: Pixar celebrates Cannes return with original 'Inside Out'
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - After a two-year hiatus, Pixar has made a sensational return to the Cannes Film Festival with "Inside Out," the kind of fresh take on animation that the studio built itself on.

"Inside Out" premiered Monday at Cannes and was among the most enthusiastically received films of the festival.

The reception to "Inside Out" was so good that some at Cannes wondered whether it should have been included in the festival's prestigious Palme d'Or competition.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Jeff Koons work to be auctioned off for charity
entry.summary:
Jeff Koons has agreed to auction off his "Coloring Book" sculpture at the amfAR gala during the 68th Cannes international film festival.

Jeff Koons is about to generate some major cash for AIDS charity amfAR: He's agreed to auction off his massive "Coloring Book" sculpture for the group's annual gala outside Cannes this week.

Organizers at amfAR are hoping "Coloring Book" can generate similar numbers for its Thursday gala at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc, just outside of Cannes in d'Antibes.

The annual amfAR "Cinema Against AIDS" gala is the glitziest event during the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Rooney Mara scores floaty white fashion coup
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) " Rooney Mara scored a fashion coup at the "Carol" premiere in a diaphanous white gown that upstaged her more famous co-star Cate Blanchett.

entry.title: Cannes swoons for 'Carol,' Todd Haynes' '50s lesbian romance
entry.summary:
"Carol," Todd Haynes' 1950s lesbian romance with Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara, had the Cannes Film Festival swooning after its premiere.

Rooney Mara and Cate Blanchett pose for photographers at the photo call for the film Carol, at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Sunday, May 17, 2015.

entry.title: CANNES TREND: It's all eyes on shoulders on red carpet
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) - It's all eyes on shoulders at the Cannes Film Festival, with red-carpet stars ditching the bust in favor of accentuating the upper torso and shoulders - through embellishments or bare skin.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Portman says new Israeli isn't political
entry.summary: The film, adapted from an autobiographical novel by Amos Oz, premiered over the weekend at the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Portman says new Israeli isn't political
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Natalie Portman's directorial debut, "A Tale of Love and Darkness," is set around the time of the formation of Israel, but the Oscar-winning actress says it doesn't have a political agenda.

Portman's film is playing as a special screening outside of the main competition at Cannes.

entry.title: Blanchett: I haven't had women lovers
entry.summary: Cate Blanchett and "Carol" director Todd Haynes at Sunday's press conference in Cannes.

entry.title: The shellfish giant: 'The Lobster' makes a big Cannes splash
entry.summary: Director Yorgos Lanthimos attends a press conference for the film The Lobster, at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Friday, May 15, 2015.

entry.title: The shellfish giant: 'The Lobster' makes a big Cannes splash
Surreal Cannes hit 'The Lobster' has audiences asking 'What animal are you?'
entry.summary:
CANNES, France - Yorgos Lanthimos has people in Cannes imagining themselves as animals.

"The Lobster" has been gobbled up by Cannes critics and audiences.
